zone.line: Threatenedst to muffle round with black destruction,
sending
A solid cloud to rain hot thunderstones,
And splinter & knead down my childrens bones,
All I bring forth, to one void mass battering & blending
Until each craglike tower & storied column
Palace, & Obelisk & Temple solemn
My imperial mountains crowned with ligh cloud & snow & fire,
My sea-like forests, every blade & blossom
Which finds a grave or cradle on my bosom
Were stamped by thy strong hate into a lifeless
mire
How art thou sunk, withdrawn, coverd—
drunk up
By thirsty nothing, as the brackish cup
Drained by a Desart-troop—a little drop for all!
And from beneath, around, within, above,
Filling thy void annihilation, Love
Bursts in like light on caves cloven by
the thunderball
The Moon
The Snow upon my lifeless mountains
Is loosened into living fountains
My solid Oceans flow & sing & shine
